The only thing I know of that ends in .ISO is an image of a Playstation game, suitable for playing in a Playstation (PSX) emulator.  Perhaps try that?  It certainly wouldn't be the same as "The Windows version," though....

Some of the comments on here are so bad they're funny. Dosbox for a windows game? c'mon, read the description,
.ISO is an extension for disc image files. Use an appropriate CD burning program to write the image to a disc. Alternatively, you could use DaemonTools to mount the image to a virtual disk drive.
